steps.title: Understand the Purpose of setserial Command

verify.name: Verify serial port information
verify.hint: The verification script checks if the `setserial -g /dev/ttyS*` command returns information about the serial ports, specifically that the UART type is "16550A". If the command does not output this information, the verification will fail.

steps.title: Identify Serial Port Information Using setserial

verify.name: Verify serial port information
verify.hint: The verification script checks if the `setserial -g /dev/ttyS*` command returns information about the serial ports, specifically that the UART type is "16550A". If the command does not output this information, the verification will fail.

steps.title: Configure Serial Port Settings with setserial

verify.name: Verify serial port configuration
verify.hint: The verification script checks if the `setserial /dev/ttyS0 -a` command shows that the baud rate is set to 115200 bps and the `spd_cust` flag is enabled. If these conditions are not met, the verification will fail.
